answers.author: Jared Dailey
answers.text:
Gary -- The first section of the attached document (pp. 1 - 5) lists all of the form of government change campaigns, known to ICMA, from 2003 through FY13 noting which communities adopted, retained, rejected, or abandoned council-manager government.  
The second section of the document (renumbered pp. 1 - 19) provides the ICMA Newsletter ("From the Ballot Box) articles for those that occurred between 2007 and 2012.
Hope this helps.  Please feel free to contact me directly with any other questions related to form of government.

author: Gary Cannon
text:
Columbia, SC, the city in which I reside, is considering changing the form of government from council-manager to mayor-council. I am assisting the citizens group opposing the change. Can anyone provide information about cities who recently have considered changing from the CM form to the MC form?
Thank you.
title: Change in Form of Government
